etymology.description: 天(天) (tiān, "person") + 雨(雨) (yǔ, "rain") = person getting wet in the rain -> 天 corrupted to 而(而) (ér) -> final form is 需
etymology.interpretation: The character 需 originally depicted a person getting wet in the rain, showing a need or requirement to stay dry. Over time, 天(天) (tiān, "person") was replaced by a corrupted form 而(而) (ér) during the Han dynasty, leading to the modern character.

examples.chinese: 学生需努力学习(學生需努力學習)。
工程师需解决问题(工程師需解決問題)，团队需协同合作(團隊需協同合作)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngchéngshī xū jiějué wèntí, tuánduì xū xiétóng hézuò.
examples.english: Engineers need to solve problems, and the team needs to cooperate.
